intro: Mimosa radula var. radulina, commonly known as the slender mimosa, is a rare and delicate flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, characterized by its pod-bearing fruits and nitrogen-fixing abilities. The plant features small, fern-like leaves and produces clusters of yellow flowers that bloom in spring. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in coastal or sandy habitats. Due to its limited distribution and specific environmental requirements, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
